Contributor: Wilson, W. N., artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "W.N. Wilson." Date of issue based on date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. The text says that the day the great gray ships of war came sneaking out from the Kiel Canal marked the end of Germany's naval power.  The German Navy had the greatest humiliation in the world.  The text urges people to do their full share in the Victory Liberty Loan in payment for the victory. Illustration shows a German ship being observed by two of the crew on the American ship.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
